required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: An outbreak of Corona virus disease 2019 (COVID-19) caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-coV-2) occurred in Wuhan city, Hubei province, China in December 2019. Pulmonary health has been the primary focus of studies during the early days of COVID-19, recent studies show that cutaneous symptoms appear in patients of all ages of COVID-19 patients, their identification may be vital to early diagnosis and lead to possible better prognosis in COVID-19 patients

detailed_description.textblock:
INTRODUCTION: An outbreak of Corona virus disease 2019 (COVID-19) caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-coV-2) occurred in Wuhan city, Hubei province, China in December 2019. Although pulmonary health has been the primary focus of studies during the early days of COVID-19, recent studies show that cutaneous symptoms appear in patients of all ages of COVID-19 patients, with differing levels of severity even in those patients who were once thought to be asymptomatic to the infection. Recent studies show association of skin manifestations of COVID-19 with severity of COVID-19 infection, which These days, ongoing interest of clinical trials. Although not much is known concerning the pathophysiologic mechanisms of these cutaneous manifestations, their identification may be vital to early diagnosis and lead to possible better prognosis in COVID-19 patients.
OBJECTIVE: To examine cutaneous manifestations of Coronavirus Disease-19 (COVID-19).
PLACE OF STUDY: Department of Dermatology Jinnah Postgraduate Medical Centre (JPMC) Karachi, Sindh, Pakistan.
RESEARCH METHODOLOGY: This descriptive longitudinal study will be conducted on patients admitted in COVID-19 isolation unit of JPMC Karachi. Permission from the institutional ethical review committee will be taken prior to conduction of study and demographic data and written informed consent will be taken from every patient or their caregivers.Non-probability convenience sampling method will be used. Sample size of study would be 350 polymerase chain reaction (PCR) for SARS-CoV-2 RNA positive patients of any gender, any age will be included. Detailed history and examination of patients including cutaneous examination be conducted in COVID-19 patients. The data would included sex, age at the time of onset of COVID-19, presence/ absence of comorbidities, the presence/absence of cutaneous manifestation, cutaneous patterns, the duration of skin manifestations, skin-related symptoms, systemic symptoms, the duration of systemic symptoms, the latency between the cutaneous manifestations and systemic symptoms, death, and the severity of COVID-19. Patients with prior skin disease will be excluded. Photographs of skin lesions will be taken.
DATA ANALYSIS: Data will be analysed using SPSS version 23 registered for Microsoft windows. Mean and standard deviation will be calculated for expression of quantitative variables like age, weight, duration of disease of skin and systemic symptoms, the latency between the cutaneous manifestations and systemic symptoms. Frequencies and percentages will be calculated for the gender, addiction, co-morbidities, presence or absence of cutaneous manifestations, cutaneous patterns, presence of skin manifestations prior to onset of systemic symptoms and systemic disease outcome. Effect modifiers like age, gender, weight, co-morbidities, duration of symptoms will be controlled through stratification. Poststratification will be recalculated and chi-square test will be applied. P-value of <0.05% will be considered as significant.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From day of randomisation until development of skin manifestations or not, assessed upto 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Frequency of skin manifestations in COVID-19 positive 350 subjects.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Disease outcome during this 6 month duration of study.
primary_outcome.description: Disease outcome of COVID-19 in participants

primary_outcome.time_frame: From day of randomisation until development of skin manifestations or not, assessed upto 6 months
primary_outcome.description: If present, type of skin manifestations to be noted

primary_outcome.measure: Association of COVID-19 disease outcome in correlation with skin manifestation
primary_outcome.time_frame: From day of randomisation until development of skin manifestations or not, until COVID-19 disease outcome (improved, worsen or death) assessed upto 6 months
primary_outcome.description: It is to check if presence of skin manifestations can affect COVID-19 disease outcome

primary_outcome.measure: Patient taking COVID-19 treatment before onset of skin manifestation
primary_outcome.time_frame: From day of randomisation until development of skin manifestations or not, assessed upto 6 months
primary_outcome.description: It is see if the rash isn't due to drug.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From day of randomisation until development of skin manifestations or not, assessed upto 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Skin symptoms as pruritis, burning or pain

secondary_outcome.measure: Latency between the cutaneous manifestations and development of systemic symptoms of COVID-19
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From day of randomisation until development of skin/systemic manifestations or not, assessed upto 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: To check if skin manifestations could be earlier symptom of COVID-19.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From day of randomisation until development of skin manifestation or not, if development/already developed skin manifestations then resolution of it or for how long it persisted, assessed upto 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: For how long the skin manifestations last before resolution or whether it persisted.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From day of randomisation to recovery or death, and also duration of symptoms prior to coming for consultation/hospital, assessed upto 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of systemic symptoms till recovery or death

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of skin manifestations developed before development of systemic symptoms of COVID-19.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of randomisation until development of skin manifestations or systemic symptoms upto 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of skin manifestations before development of systemic symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Most common site affected by skin manifestation.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From day of randomisation until development of skin manifestations or not, assessed upto 6 months

study_pop.textblock: 350 patients diagnosed case of COVID-19 with or without skin manifestations.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
both genders Any age PCR diagnosed COVID-19 patient COVID-19 systemic manifestations as asymptomatic or symptomatic with or without cutaneous manifestation with or without comorbidities any duration of systemic and cutaneous disease
Exclusion Criteria:
patient with diagnosed case of autoimmune disease on drugs known case of malignancy recurrent transfusion history diagnosed case of malabsorption syndrome patient who was already taking immunosuppressant.
Already having any prior skin disease

overall_official.last_name: Syeda Mahanum Ali, MBBS, Postgraduate Trainee
